document_title: Hand, foot and mouth disease: Causes, symptoms and care
subsection_content:
According to Master, Doctor Le Phan Kim Thoa - Former Head of Pediatrics Department, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, hand, foot and mouth disease (English name is HFMD - Hand, foot and mouth disease) is caused by a virus, characterized by fever and the appearance of blisters, typically on the soles of the feet, hands and palate. The disease is common in infants and children under 5 years old, and a few in adults. The disease often occurs year-round, but peak outbreaks are from February to April and from September to December. (1)
According to statistics from the Department of Preventive Medicine, the number of deaths from hand, foot and mouth disease is mainly caused by the EV71 virus, of which the most common deaths are in children under 3 years old (accounting for 75% - 86%). of all deaths due to hand, foot and mouth disease in children).
